content.text:
[@cryptix](@p13zSAiOpguI9nsawkGijsnMfWmFd5rlUNpzekEE+vI=.ed25519) [@André Staltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) 

I would support dropping Node.js 6 and supporting *only* [active LTS and maintenance LTS](https://github.com/nodejs/Release). Deploying an SSB application to an environment that's *already* in maintenance LTS doesn't sound like a use-case that's worth the time/energy to support, but if anyone would be blocked by this decision I'd appreciate feedback.
